website_summaries.verdict: The Canon PowerShot A4000 IS is a very compact camera that's easy to use, with dedicated help screens for beginners. It features a high resolution and a long zoom but there's more noise in the results than there ought to be, and some light streaking in movies. While very well priced, spending a little more would pay dividends.
cons: More noise in some results than there should be
No optical zoom in video mode

customer_reviews.title: Second Malfunctioning Canon PowerShot
customer_reviews.text: With minimal use (@400 shots) and excellent care the lens mechanism will not extend. This is the 2nd Canon that has done this. Calling Canon is a real hassle and after long holds they offered me a 15% discount on another Canon camera.They will not even service the product.If I shop around I can purchase a Canon product for at least a 30% discount. Google searches reveal countless Canon customers experiencing lens problems with the PowerShot line. Stay away from this brand of cameras
customer_reviews.author: Barry E.

customer_reviews.title: The most digital camera you can buy at this price point
customer_reviews.text: I've been an amateur and professional photographer for 50 years. This is my favorite pocket camera. It does not cost a fortune, so if I lose it -- and you do lose these things -- I am not out a fortune. This is the third one I have owned It takes decent video with sound, and good still shots. It has a good variety of pre-programmed 'modes,' and I particularly like the silent or stealth mode. It is durable. Survives minor falls. Relatively moisture-proof, unlike the Casio. Not fazed by very hot or very cold weather. Battery life is excellent, and it can be re-charged on the same charger in Europe or the USA. How can you beat it?
customer_reviews.author: William Marling

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I'm a camera buff and semi-pro photographer. I've been in galleries and all that. Fine art. I've had over 40 digital cameras, as well a a bunch of film ones. This is my go-everywhere camera, believe it or not. Small, fairly light, and takes great pictures AND video! Bring the pics into Photoshop and with a couple clicks you end up with REALLY stunning shots. But even straight out of the camera I'm amazed. Especially for the money. Now, if you want to drop some serious money, the best bigger, but not as big as a DSLR, digital camera out right now is the Olympus OM-D E-M1. Mind-blowing. But $1,400.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes awful pictures
customer_reviews.text: I buy cameras that are less than $150 because with 2 toddlers they always get dropped or destroyed somehow. This is by far the worst one I have had (3 in the last 3 years). The picture quality is awful. The colors are off. A lot of pictures come out blurry. I am hoping one of my kids will drop it in a large pool of water so that it can forever be gone from my life. Okay, that's a little dramatic...but it's so useless that I just end up taking photos on my iphone. It's so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and functional
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera, but slow to respond to shutter pressure. It takes a couple of seconds for the camera to allow you to take another picture, which is rather annoying! Photos are good quality, but setting the various modes is difficult. The manual is also on a disk, so you have to be at a computer to check out the various functions. This is silly, and how expensive can a little manual be to include in the package? I have had easier cameras to explore and use...but this is a very nice photo when you figure it out! Auto focus has several options, and seems accurate.
customer_reviews.author: MaryT

customer_reviews.title: beautiful pictures, simple to use (my wife could use ...
customer_reviews.text: arrived quickly, birthday present for wife. beautiful pictures, simple to use (my wife could use it right outa the box without reading any instructions). I think she has taken 99,999 pictures with it so far. filling all our HDs and flash drives. we now have pictures of everything happing in our lives, in our kid's lives, in our grand kids lives and all our neighbors lives......... she's happy so I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bloxsom

customer_reviews.title: Broke rather quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Broke after about a year. Canon must be lowering its standards because my son's older silver canon can at least still turn on if he fiddles with the lens servos. This one won't even extend the lens out before posting a "lens error" and he never mistreated this one to the best of my knowledge. Especially since he was super sad about breaking the lens servos on his silver camera which he's now forced to use. We bought a fuji to replace this.
customer_reviews.author: The G Residence

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Canon cameras before and they seem to be the best bang for my buck! Two months ago I replaced my Kodak with a Nikon, and I can say I will never, ever be buying a Nikon again. This camera is everything the Nikon wasn't, and an upgrade from my Kodak. It's easy to use, very fast, and I think the thing I'm most excited about is how clear pictures without the flash on turn out. A camera that takes non-blurry photos with the flash off is a feature I had yet to have found in a camera, and this one did the trick. I'm excited to use it more :)!
customer_reviews.author: chels_21

customer_reviews.title: great photos, but easily killed by sand or water
customer_reviews.text: The camera takes sharp pictures for a camera that fits in your pocket. It's easy to use and the battery lasts a long time. I've had about 4-6 of these cameras. From the very beginning, they were easily killed by the slightest amount of water or sand. But now I've gone through 4 of them in about two years. The two most recent 'deaths' of these cameras came with only slight contact with dusty soil. One of them was dropped in the dust. But the other was 'killed' by just minor contact with very little sand.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Derne

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this model from Canon. it is bad.
customer_reviews.text: I have had to ask Canon to replace this model (A4000) IS two times in less than a year. The first camera stopped turn on after 4 months; it was replaced by canon, and the second want was good for another few months , then it started to show a "lens error" and didn't start it. There is something wrong with this model, but the Canon's representatives don't know it or don't want to accept it. So good luck if you decide to but it.
customer_reviews.author: sescobar

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot A4000IS Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-designed small camera with many more features than I'll ever use. However, learning to use its basic features is fairly straightforward with the aid of the instruction booklet included with the camera. I recently took it on the road to Colorado for a relative's wedding and took around 60 photos which turned out quite nicely. The photos also proved easy to download to Picasa and upload to the internet for viewing by family members in different areas. Quite pleased with the Canon PowerShot.
customer_reviews.author: George Mosby

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera.
customer_reviews.text: REALLY like this camera--takes very clear, balanced photos, lots of nice features (including movies and zoom), easy to download photos to computer with cable attachment (can use downloadable software from Canon, together with iPhoto), nice-looking and sturdy (I dropped mine, with no ill-effects). My one criticism is that the battery life is not all that long--but if you're not out all day on a photo expedition, this shouldn't be too much of a problem.
customer_reviews.author: James Ward

customer_reviews.title: Love, but a bit of a learning curve.
customer_reviews.text: My last 3 cameras have all been a point and shoot Canon, similar to this style. (my favorite is two back. It still takes the best photos, but the side fell off.) Anyway, this one is simpler, I think, but I need to learn the new system. For instance, to customize settings for a photo quickly, you hit the function button, have 3 sliders to adjust light-dark, vivid-dull, warm-cool. I think that's going to be quicker, once I get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: La Na

customer_reviews.title: good amateur camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is perfect for someone who just wants pictures for memories or fun. The main problem is that if it is on auto it can take a few seconds to determine circumstances so it takes longer to take a picture. After, however, it determines circumstances, if you take another picture in the same place it is much faster. The quality of video for a hand held camera is excellent and the pictures are good as well. For my uses, it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Befort

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot A4000 - a very nice camera
customer_reviews.text: I like a point and shoot camera and this one fits the bill nicely. It is very compact to take along in my purse and very easy to use. I like the one door that holds both the SD card and the battery. I also like the compact convience of the battery charger. It is very easy to take the wall charger with me when I travel. I have used this camera for 4 months. The door is stronger than the SD door on my Nikon Coolpix that broke.
customer_reviews.author: Pat W

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my old one
customer_reviews.text: I found the perfect little camera for packing around in my pocket with the kids and dogs! This was it. We keep/share a lot of memories this way.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Selg Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Pocket Cam, Beautiful Results 2014
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to keep on hand to get those spur of the moment hobby quick shots. I'm a photographer by trade but can't always have my camera with me and this certainly is a great stand in for my personal use, even if it's a couple years old. Shoots wonderful video but I mostly use the camera. You can extend the zoom further than is stated as ither reviews claim for sure, wide angles are great, clear crisp photos.
customer_reviews.author: Othermom

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am a great fan of Samsung cameras when it comes to point and shoot, but was surprised when i opened this one and used it. wife actually brought this as a gift for in-laws and was mad when it came to handing it. they love it and have become a professional photographers now (would use them sometime). overall a great product for point and shoot camera for novice users and easy to carry around in pocket than in a bulky case
customer_reviews.author: Chirag Purohit

customer_reviews.title: nice optical zoom
customer_reviews.text: camera isn't perfect, but I just needed something to take decent quality pix during my recent Caribbean vacation. As you'd expect night/dark pictures leave little to be desired but everything else came out just great. Really you buy this camera for taking pix on the go and archiving memories, with the auto setting it pretty much does all the hard work for you and the pix come out pretty good in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Great Bargain!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for $99 and find it well worth it's full price of $200. So far I have only used it in the Auto setting but caught a stunning nighttime closeup of a yellow rose with raindrops clinging to the petals. The photo was crisp and clear and the color accurate. Also like the sturdy feeling of the body, nothing cheap in the construction, and yet it is reasonably small and light enough to slip into my pocket. Looking forward to many more adventures with this Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Curious1

customer_reviews.title: 1 &1/2 years the Flash goes bad. Sent it in thinking it was under warranty
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of S***. 1 &1/2 years the Flash goes bad. Sent it in thinking it was under warranty, wrong. They want $60 to fix a $100.00 camera. Told them put the camera where the sun doesn't shine. Have had trouble with Amazon products in past. Going to try something else. I ALSO SUGGEST YOU GO ELSEWHERE. S. W. Cooper, Tucson, Arizona
customer_reviews.author: stephen cooper

customer_reviews.title: Expected more from Canon
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 other Canon cameras and I shoot with one for work (price range $250-$3,000). I bought this for my 9 year old as a starter camera. I like the simplicity of its functions which is great for people who just want to point and shoot and have no use for or patience to learn how to use the many features and benefits of more expensive cameras. However, the picture quality and camera responsiveness is not what I have come to expect from Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, I bought this after looking at several ...
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, I bought this after looking at several reviews and trying to get the best deal for my money. I used it for a two weeks trip to Europe and it worked great a lot of situations like low light or with the sun right in front of me. It has an auto mode for just pointing and clicking or manual where you could adjust several settings to get the best picture. It also comes with some presets e.g. fireworks, night scene, snow scene etc. (which I haven't tried) it does not come with a Panorama mode.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Escobar

customer_reviews.title: Little workhorse
customer_reviews.text: This little baby really delivers. Has more features than I'll ever use and the AUTO mode gets some great shots for a change. LCD display could be brighter: Hard to see sometimes under bright sunlight. Have dropped it, got it wet, basically beat it up in my jersey pocket on bike rides and it just takes a lickin' and keeps on tickin'. Does GREAT HD video too.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Rabbitt

customer_reviews.title: Point & Shoot
customer_reviews.text: Excellent picture quality. My previous Cannon was similar size with a view finder. Newer small digital cameras don't have view finders. I missed the view finder feature originally but I'm adjusting. Video quality is excellent for such a small camera. Owned this for 2 months, easy to slip in a pocket or purse - ready for that quick shot! Several features I have yet to use but should enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Shar

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for its time.
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely outdated, your phone probably takes better photos now. It was a good camera in 2014! Small and compact, easy to take anywhere. Pretty sturdy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alichan

customer_reviews.title: very slow
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very pritty and it takes good pictures once you figure it out but it is very very slow and very stubborn about it. Its good for things that hold still but if it moves your in trouble with this one and if it dont think its ready its not gonna take the picture knowmatter what you say or do. It would be a nice camera for just taking portraits but i have 12grandkids and they never hold still. Im very disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: samantha

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: We have a larger DSL camera but it is difficult to use. This camera is small, lightweight, and feels solid. Its easy to use and fits in your pocket. The buttons are small but surprisingly function well and the back screen looks great and is a perfect size. I plan to buy one for my parents for Christmas because they are using an old cheap Kodak that takes crap pictures. I got this for $129 and I think its a great deal for this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Tallahassee

customer_reviews.title: Really happy
customer_reviews.text: Wow. Great photos. Great close ups with no light of my cats. Am really looking forward to taking this with me on my upcoming trip. HIGHLY suggest this ... don't forget to get a memory card. And I bought an extra battery, which I find really helpful, but that was my own choice.
customer_reviews.author: C.R. of Solvang

customer_reviews.title: Nice little travel companion!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little camera. Fits easily in a pocket or hangs off your belt. Zoom lense is nice to have, but at this cost, it's not perfect. Some major 'zoom ins' end up pretty grainy, but overall, a nice little digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Maurer

customer_reviews.title: Great compact digital camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this Canon! It is very versatile, easy to use, lightweight, and compact enough to carry anywhere. I love the choice of color that is available for this model. It fits beautifully in the case that I purchased for it. I also have a DSLR by Canon for more serious photography, so I knew this smaller camera would have the Canon quality I'm used to.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley V.

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a full featured point and shoot camera at a decent price. Cannon has put together a solid package. There are more features here than most people will use. I would not bother paying more for a higher Cannon model unless you really need something that this does not have. After taking our first set of pictures I plugged it into my Mac with the supplied USB cable and iPhoto imported the pictures without hassle. Note: This did not come with a SD memory card which you will need.
customer_reviews.author: AC3

customer_reviews.title: Can't open battery door
customer_reviews.text: The battery door was extremely hard to open and since you need to remove the battery every time to recharge, this was an awefule design. Not sure if it was meant to be more water tight or a design defect but bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Lens is stuck and wont open after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: I have been pleased with this camera--good pictures, easy to use--but it has broken after 9 months of use. The lens is stuck in the "closed" position, so when you turn on the camera, it tries to open the lens and then says "error" and shuts down. We haven't dropped it or anything. I have put it in my purse and maybe it got jostled, but you would expect it to tolerate that.
customer_reviews.author: RA

customer_reviews.title: I've loved every Canon I've ever owned, and this is no exception
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for a while now, and it does a great job. Although I miss the smaller size of my Elph, this one isn't too terribly bulky, it still fits in my pocket. I've taken it on road trips, days at Disney World, all kinds of places and I end up with great pictures. It also does really well in low light situations.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Shutter problem
customer_reviews.text: Although this may be a one-off issue, thought I should mention it. For the one I got, the shutter does not close properly. When you press "off", you can tell it tries to close but is stuck. You have to manually push it back in. Also a minor issue. The battery cabin is very difficult to open. You have to press and slip very hard to open it. When I showed to my father, he cannot even open it. Again, not sure if this is a one-off thing. Just want to let you know what I got. It was supposed to be a gift for my father who is in another country. So this is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: First time with Cannon and loving it!
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera, takes excellent pictures, and highly recommend. Also, love that I can now do videos although have a video cam, never did learn how to use and this is so simple with the camera. Very pleased. I just wish I could understand more as so many settings. One problem I'm having is finding out how to lighten at night when shooting video outside in dark.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Best camera we ever owned so far.
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to operate and takes good clear shots of our outdoor lights and creations during twilight hours (semi darkness). Our last camera caused our lights to streak, whereas Canon A4000IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 8x optical image, doesn't... unless, of course, you are pretty unsteady. Plus it's compact and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanna H. Keats

customer_reviews.title: good little workhorse
customer_reviews.text: a good little workhorse of a camera. not great at any one thing, but it is good at most things and very easy to carry with you. With the quality of smart phone cameras getting very nearly this good, it is almost obsolete, but offers more functions and a slight edge on picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Persnickety

customer_reviews.title: Good Pictures
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like the camera very much but I don't like the smaller size of cameras in general. I take pictures while riding my horse and I am always afraid of dropping a small camera. I find the instructions for downloading of pictures from camera to computer confusing. I have limited computer skills and perhaps someone more knowledgeable would not have a problem. I did manage to download the pics. The image stabilizing feature is important for me as my "quadripod" is not always still while taking pics! So far, no blurry pics. I have used both the zoom and the macro with success. I have only owned the camera for about a month so I am still discovering features.
customer_reviews.author: Joan L. Ganotis

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I had this exact camera before. It's a great bargain for the price and takes really excellent pictures. I love the widescreen setting as it let's you get more image in the picture. It really does best on bright, sunny days but I've taken some great night shots, action shots, and closeups. All in all, a great point and shoot for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Kashmere

customer_reviews.title: Do it.
customer_reviews.text: I researched and researched and settled upon this little beauty. It's compact, it takes clear photos, and it's simple to use for a great price! what more can I ask for? I wanted this camera so I can actually print photos instead of having a million camera photos online and so far it is working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for my teen daughters
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these hoping i wouldn't be sorry. they were gifts for my two young teen daughters. I love these little cameras. Definately worth the money. this camera takes clear and crisp still pictures. Action pictures not so much, but they take pictures of them and their friends and they are great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Since you've been gone

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat Canon
customer_reviews.text: I have a Rebel, but thought it would be nice to have something smaller. For the most part I like it, except for a delay when pressing the button to take a picture. Easy to operate, i like the rechargable battery. The seller was very responsive - i received it 3-4 days after i purchased it. Good price w/free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: fusy buyer

customer_reviews.title: Canon Brand
customer_reviews.text: For the price, size, and for my travel here and there needs, this camera works just fine. I own several cameras and another larger Canon camera, but I needed something small easy to carry in a jacket or clip on to my belt, via the case I bought for it. I am extremely happy with this camera and what it can provide me.
customer_reviews.author: Leo of San Francisco.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, not super stellar
customer_reviews.text: Shutter speed not super fast, but gets the job done. Picture quality seems to be pretty good though sometimes doesn't fully autofocus. I'm a point and shoot sort of basic mom photographer, so real skills, so this serves me well enough to capture activities and still shots well enough at a low price.
customer_reviews.author: crhg

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm so sad because this item has not held up well. The shutters stick and it doesn't focus well any longer. I've had it for less that a full year and was told not to bother getting it fixed. It makes more sense to get a new one. I'm looking into Cannon's recycling program for this.
customer_reviews.author: Calimamjam

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: This summer I had the awful experience of losing my old Canon PowerShot while on vacation. I was heart broken because I loved that camera and had taken many wonderful pictures with it. After a week of researching for a replacement I settled on this one and I have not been disappointed. It is easy to use and, like my old camera, it takes great pictures without a lot of fuss. If that is what you are looking for this camera is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Pski

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This camera was to replace an old Elph, but instead it's my backup camera. The camera has problems focusing. I take a lot of pictures, and 99% are not crisp and in focus--especially faces. Colors are dull and washed out, and sometimes the color balance is off. The video part works when the subject is not moving and the sound quality is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Colibri

customer_reviews.title: Hope my experience is an exception..
customer_reviews.text: Bought the camera for my daughter based on reviews I saw of the product on Amazon. She must have used the camera on 3 occasions and then gave it back to me saying it did not work. The battery would not recharge and we were prompted to replace the battery pack. I spent additional $$ replacing the battery pack. Now the shutter does not close and I am being told the battery pack is bad and I need to get another one. I am now tossing this one as $$ poorly spent and am looking for a better camera.
customer_reviews.author: karthik chandran

customer_reviews.title: She takes it everywhere and she always takes great photos. It is small and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter's 11th birthday and she loves it. She takes it everywhere and she always takes great photos. It is small and easy to use. Great to take along for vacations, holidays, and special occasions and pictures beat what most smartphones take.
customer_reviews.author: Ayanna

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a couple years ago and haven't used it yet because it won't turn on, and if it does, it freezes on the first screen. Wasted my money 😢
customer_reviews.author: MzBlackanese

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Compact Camera
customer_reviews.text: For the price I think this camera is great quality. The reason i gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that it takes a little longer than i like for it to focus. Other than that I like the picture quality. Overall I wanted a compact camera with good quality pictures for a reasonable price. This camera was just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: sambrose

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The quality is inconsistent-I should have returned it. In the beginning I thought I just needed to become more familiar with the camera but the quality never improved. I have friends with the same camera and whenever they looked at my camera they weren't sure why mine didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: DAnie118

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and Affordable Camera
customer_reviews.text: The Canon PowerShot A4000IS, which can be bought refurbished at a very low price, is a nice entry level point and shoot. It can also be made into a powerful enthusiast camera using the Canon Hack Development Tool, CHDK. Installation of CHDK allows one, amongst many other things, to save images in RAW format.
customer_reviews.author: Gustav Nilsson

customer_reviews.title: Gat Cannon Camers
customer_reviews.text: I have a larger more professional type camera, but needed a smaller one for use in in collecting rocks and taking pictures of my desert adventures. I like the camera it works well and I am mostly satisfied with the quality pictures it produces. A good performing Camera even in dusty dirty conditions, so far.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Good purse, travel camera, but shutter breaks easily.
customer_reviews.text: The shutter breaks easily. I've bought two and same problem. It's a moving part and once the shutter has a problem, the camera won't turn on. It is also expensive to repair, which is why I bought another. It's shutter got stuck also. Other than that, it's a good purse camera for travel, and you can video. Best photos are outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Anne

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: After my last camera took a fatal tumble, it was time to make a new purchase. This camera is great for the price, and came in a bundle with a memory card and camera case (don't know if this was a one-time promotion or not). Easy to use and nice picture quality, this camera was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ACustomer0920

customer_reviews.title: Good camera overall
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional photographer, not do I use all of the options available on the camera (at least not yet), but this is a pretty good overall camera. The only thing I take issue with is that there is often a delay in the camera taking a picture after pressing the button and I've missed quite a few good shots of my children because of this - it seems to get stuck focusing or something. It seems pretty sturdy so far and well made, but we've only had it for a couple of months. The picture quality is good as well. For a camera in this price range (~$100) it is a good option.
customer_reviews.author: VTpug

customer_reviews.title: Slow to focus
customer_reviews.text: This is an OK camera but is slow to focus even when set on auto. The pictures come out OK thou. It says that you can continue to take pictures even when the previous is still on the screen, but I don't dare because of the long focus time.
customer_reviews.author: Renee B.Kharboush

customer_reviews.title: Lense stop working
customer_reviews.text: After 6 month of used of the camera, the lense stop working, present the next message: "Lens error Will shut down automatically" and Restart camera and you can't use it. I strongly do NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: alevp45

customer_reviews.title: Good little Camara for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I can actually take good photos with this Camera, battery life is pretty amazing. I had other cameras that every time I pulled them from my case to take a picture the battery was flat, just went flat not even being used. This Canon has a full battery even after months of non use.
customer_reviews.author: Gaffer

customer_reviews.title: nice product
customer_reviews.text: We already have a Canon so when we got this we weren't surprised by the ease of use and were impressed by the size of the screen. Even though we measured it prior to ordering it was still a surprise to see how big the screen is in relation the size of the whole camera..And I love the color!
customer_reviews.author: L O'C

customer_reviews.title: This camera did not disappoint. It takes great pictures
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot reviews before purchasing this camera. This camera did not disappoint. It takes great pictures. Have not attempted to take a video yet.
customer_reviews.author: CTH

customer_reviews.title: poor camera
customer_reviews.text: this camera developed a piece of dust or something internal that makes a small dark spot on every pic . was out of warranty, but had hardly been used.

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera, color needs adjusting

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot A4000IS 16.0 MP Digital Camera with 8x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom 28mm Wide-Angle Lens with 720p HD Video Recording and 3.0-Inch LCD (Blue) (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlueThe Canon 6152B100 PowerShot A4000 IS 16MP Compact Digital Camera, in blue, boasts advanced capabilities and chic style that set it apart from the crowd. It is equipped with a powerful 8x Optical Zoom to get you close to the action fast, and a 28mm Wide-Angle lens and Optical Image Stabilizer that deliver beautifully clear images with more excitement in every frame. This chic, compact camera has a 16.0 Megapixel Image Sensor with DIGIC 4 Image Processor to ensure superior resolution and fast performance. Beautiful images are easy thanks to Smart AUTO that picks the perfect camera settings for 32 predefined shooting situations, and Intelligent IS that automatically optimizes image stabilization based on the shooting conditions. Touch a button and you'll be shooting brilliantly lifelike 720p HD video.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

TAKE A CLOSER LOOK
Advanced capabilities and chic style set PowerShot A4000 IS digital camera apart from the crowd. In a new high for the A-Series, it's equipped with a powerful 8x Optical Zoom to get you close to the action fast, and a 28mm Wide-Angle lens and Optical Image Stabilizer that deliver beautifully clear images with more excitement in every frame. This chic, compact camera in a range of appealing colors has a 16.0 Megapixel Image Sensor with DIGIC 4 Image Processor to ensure superior resolution and fast performance. Beautiful images are easy thanks to Smart AUTO that picks the perfect camera settings for 32 predefined shooting situations, and Intelligent IS that automatically optimizes image stabilization based on the shooting conditions. Touch a button and you'll be shooting brilliantly lifelike 720p HD video!

ZOOM IN ON WIDER, STEADIER SHOTS
8x Optical Zoom with 28mm Wide-Angle Lens The 8x Optical Zoom (35mm equivalent: 28–224mm) in PowerShot A4000 IS digital camera is the most powerful ever seen in Canon’s A-Series.It gives you a huge range of potential images from a single location, which is perfect for sporting events and other occasions when your shooting stance is fixed, or times when moving in too close might disrupt the action you’re trying to capture. The lens’s 28mm wide-angle perspective puts more image in every frame for dynamic, exciting shots.





OPTICAL IMAGE STABILIZER
Handheld shooting can often lead to camera shake, making photos and videos blurry. Canon’s Optical Image Stabilizer is a sophisticated system that uses lens-shift technology to correct unwanted camera movement. It makes handheld photography more practical, providing excellent image quality in many difficult shooting situations: outdoors at dusk, inside without a flash, and even at the telephoto end of the zoom range without a tripod. For photos, it enables shooting at slower shutter speeds, accommodating more low-light shooting situations than ever before without having to boost ISO sensitivity. With camera shake and vibration reduced, you get a sharper, steadier image. And because it is an optical system, there is none of the image degradation typical with electronic image stabilizers.


HIGH RESOLUTION, HIGHLY ADVANCED PERFORMANCE
16.0 MEGAPIXEL IMAGE SENSOR WITH DIGIC 4 IMAGE PROCESSOR
With the camera’s 16.0 Megapixels of resolution, your images are rich and clear, with textures and tiny details faithfully reproduced even at the long end of the big 8x Optical Zoom. This high level of resolution is ideal for creating the largest prints, and allows you the flexibility to blow up and crop any section of an image to express your creativity. The DIGIC 4 Image Processor powers the cameraâ€™s advanced systems and features, ensuring fast, reliable performance with low battery consumption.

DIGIC 4 IMAGE PROCESSOR
Canon DIGIC Image Processors have set the standard for functionality and performance since their groundbreaking introduction in 1999. With each successive generation, DIGIC processors have brought elevated performance and powerful new features to PowerShot digital cameras. The DIGIC 4 Image Processor has ushered in a new level of picture quality and accelerated processing, making possible features such as high-speed continuous shooting, HD video and Face Detection Self-timer.

A SMARTER CAMERA MEANS BETTER PHOTOS
SMART AUTO
Photographers of all levels appreciate a camera – especially a go-anywhere compact digital – that takes the hassle out of capturing beautiful images. The PowerShot A4000 IS digital camera gives you Smart AUTO – sophisticated Canon technology that makes getting that great shot as simple as pressing the shutter button. Smart AUTO automatically detects scenes by assessing various factors in both the background and the subject. Detected scenes are analyzed using 32 predefined shooting situations. The camera then makes optimal settings to ensure the best possible image capture when shooting still images. Smart AUTO also includes Advanced Subject Detection, which allows the camera to detect and track non-human moving subjects like animals and vehicles. With Smart AUTO, all you have to do is frame your shot and capture away.

SHOOTING MODES/SPECIAL SCENE MODES
Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Program The camera automatically and intelligently selects the aperture/shutter speed combination based on the shooting conditions. Live View Control Enables Brightness, Color, and Tone adjustments to your images using easy-to-understand controls. Portrait Brings the subject into focus while beautifully blurring the background. Face Self-timer The camera waits for a face to enter the frame before releasing the shutter. Low Light For high quality image capture in an amazing range of dimly lit situations. Fisheye Effect Now you can get the fisheye effect – a classic photographic distortion – without a fisheye lens. Miniature Effect Give images a miniature look with an effect that emphasizes perspective by blurring the top and bottom of the image. Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with â€œtoyâ€ or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect. Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue. Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts. Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint. Fireworks Create brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Long Shutter Use to blur moving subjects for artistic effect, ideal for urban night photography. Discreet Mode Disables flash, AF assist beam, and all camera sounds with one mode dial settingâ€“so you can capture images in quiet areas. iFrame Movie The Apple® movie format, iFrame, makes it easier and quicker to import and upload videos while retaining high image quality. 
GORGEOUS HD VIDEO FROM YOUR STILL CAMERA
720P HD VIDEO
You can shoot high definition video anytime, anywhere right from the pocket-sized A4000 IS. With a simple push of the dedicated movie button, you'll be able to instantly record every moment in motion. 720p HD video is smooth, vivid, and beautifully lifelike, making it an ideal way to capture special memories. In addition to being able to shoot 720p HD video at 25 frames per second, the PowerShot A4000 IS can also shoot 640 x 480 VGA video at 30* frames per second.

DEDICATED MOVIE BUTTON FOR EASY VIDEO CAPTURE
It's never been easier to shoot videos with a PowerShot digital camera. To make shooting video as natural as snapping pictures, the PowerShot A4000 IS has a dedicated movie button. No need to plan ahead, no need to search through menus on the LCD screen; when you feel a moment would be best captured in 720p HD, simply press the button and recording begins. The camera is always ready to shoot stills or video whenever you want.

IFRAME 
With the PowerShot A4000 IS digital camera, you can also shoot video in the AppleÂ® iFrame format, which is a computer-friendly standard that speeds up importing and editing of videos. It keeps file sizes small, making it more convenient to upload or e-mail high-quality videos. The iFrame format enjoys native support in compatible Mac and Windows video applications, making it unnecessary to perform time-consuming and often quality-degrading conversions.

SEE THE IMAGE ON A BIG SCREEN
3.0-INCH LCD
The PowerShot A4000 IS digital camera’s large 3.0-inch LCD screen gives you the big picture, whether you’re shooting, reviewing or showing off your images. This high-resolution screen offers a crisp, clear and bright picture. It also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light.

A STEADY IMAGE IS A BEAUTIFUL IMAGE
INTELLIGENT IS
The latest advance in Canon Optical Image Stabilization technology, Intelligent IS analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes. With Intelligent IS, you can concentrate on image capture, letting the camera make the most effective IS settings to assure the steadiest possible image.

Normal Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills.

Panning Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement.

Macro (Hybrid) Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting.

Dynamic Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking.

Powered Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified.

Tripod When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed.


HELP YOU WON'T NEED HELP TO FIND
HELP BUTTON
The PowerShot A4000 IS digital camera is designed to be fun and easy to use, even for beginners. A new Help Button on the camera’s exterior brings up the help menu any time you need it, right on the LCD screen. From here, you can scroll through a variety of topics that answer your questions with clear explanations, offer helpful shooting advice, and show you diagrams highlighting the position of any buttons you'll need.

MORE WAYS TO GET CREATIVE
SCENE MODES
Scene Modes are fun, easy ways to give your shots a distinctly artistic feel without the need for any extra lenses and filters. Super Vivid heightens and saturates colors for eye-popping intensity. Poster Effect eliminates gradations between colors for an illustrative feel. Miniature Effect enhances perspective in a scene, blurring the top and bottom to make it look as if it were created with miniature models. You can also make a quirky portrait using the Fisheye Effect or add a beautiful single-tone effect with Monochrome. Toy Camera Effect simulates a vintage look as it capturing the photo using a toy or pinhole camera.


CHARGE UP AND GO!
LITHIUM-ION BATTERY
The Canon PowerShot A4000 IS digital camera uses a rechargeable Lithium-ion battery. This compact, powerful battery helps make it a lightweight and slim camera. Charge-up is quick and easy, so the PowerShot A4000 IS will be ready and waiting for those special moments.


A COLOR JUST RIGHT FOR YOU
AVAILABLE IN 5 COLORS
While the classic black camera will always be right for a lot of photographers, Canon recognizes that others will long for colors that express their individuality. Accordingly, the PowerShot A4000 IS digital camera is offered in a range of hues from subtle to vibrant, fun to chic. Take your pick from black, silver, blue, red, and pink.
